ResponseText: So many people are upset about others burning the flag. My question is: Why don't they just start making the flag out of flame-resistant material? It wouldn't be that hard and then the people wouldn't have "their" flag burnt, it would be the old one, or people burning it would be like trying to XXXX out those fake candles, it wouldn't work.

QuoteText: then some one else would make one out of flash paper.
ResponseText: But it wouldn't be THE flag. Sort of like how a picture of a flag on a napkin isn't considered a flag. I was pretty much joking, but I really think it would be bad if they banned flag burning so I was proposing a compromise.

QuoteText: So many people are upset about others burning the flag. My question is: Why don't they just start making the flag out of flame-resistant material? It wouldn't be that hard and then the people wouldn't have "their" flag burnt, it would be the old one, or people burning it would be like trying to XXXX out those fake candles, it wouldn't work.
ResponseText: But then, people won't be able to burn it when it's dirty.
